messages.text: Hello, I'm Isaac, and I'm here to assist you with your robot programming task. I understand that you have a clear idea of what you want to achieve but are unsure of how to implement it using the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool. Could you please provide more details about the task you want to accomplish? This way, I can guide you through the process more effectively.
how do i move the robot

To move the robot using the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool, you will need to use the blocks under the "Move" category. There are two types of movement blocks available: 

1. "Move <tool> <speed> to <somewhere>": This block will move the robot to a specified position. The movement will be made by joint, meaning the robot will move each joint independently to reach the final position.

2. "Move <tool> <speed> in a straight line to <somewhere>": This block will move the robot in a straight line to a specified position. 

In both blocks, you need to specify the tool, speed, and position. The tool and speed should not be changed as per the rules of the experiment. The position should be selected from the pre-defined robot positions available.

Remember to click the "Apply" button at the top center of the programming environment to save your changes every time you make an update in your program solution.
